qas.question: Roughly how many Malians are descendants of slaves?
What is the estimate of current Mali enslavement?
What group of people were known to keep Malian salves into the 20th century?
The darker skinned Bella people are also refereed to as what name?
What region of the country is historical slavery well known?

plausible_answers.text: Berber-descendent Tuareg nomad populations and the darker-skinned Bella or Tamasheq people,

qas.question: Who is their division between in the South?

plausible_answers.text: the historical spread of slavery in the region

qas.question: How many people in Mali are descended from slaveowners?
What did the Arabic authorities suppress in the twentieth century?

context: In the <a4_0>far north<a4_0/>, there is a division between <b5_0>Berber-descendent Tuareg nomad populations and the darker-skinned Bella or <a3_0>Tamasheq<a3_0/> people,<b5_0/> due <b6_0>the historical spread of slavery in the region<b6_0/>. An estimated <a0_0><b7_0>800,000<b7_0/><a0_0/> people in Mali are descended from slaves. Slavery in Mali has persisted for centuries. The <a2_0><b8_0>Arabic population<b8_0/><a2_0/> kept slaves well into the 20th century, until <b9_0>slavery<b9_0/> was suppressed by French authorities around the mid-20th century. There still persist certain hereditary servitude relationships, and according to some estimates, even today approximately <a1_0>200,000<a1_0/> Malians are still enslaved.
